III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to
Section requirements; staff qualifications.
Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Between 2022-2023, youth was involved in a PREA investigation
due to the staff being inappropriate sexually and crossing
boundaries.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on November 17,
2023. Complainant reported they have no further information.
Youth A was interviewed by Carehouse Children’s
Assessment Center on November 28, 2023. Youth A frequently
talked with her head down making her difficult to understand and
she mumbled frequently. Youth A also at times appeared hesitant
to answer questions. Youth A reported she liked the last
placement, Bay Pines Center, and the staff were friendly. Youth A
reported self-injury and that she has been “very suicidal”. Youth A
reported Staff 2 was her staff at Bay Pines Center, and he would
grab her and try to talk to her, would grab her and take her
glasses off, tell her she was pretty, and would come to her room
and would “say some stuff” like sexual stuff and how pretty she is.
Youth A said Staff 2 never hurt her, and that he did it to another
girl and got fired from Bay Pines Center. Youth A reported Staff 2
would stare at them when they were “twerking”, and he would
glare at her. When asked to clarify about what he would say
sexually to her, Youth A reported “I told you”, and denied doing
anything else to her. Youth A struggled to provide specific details
2

at times when asked. Youth A denied Staff 2 tried to do anything
else sexually to her. Youth A denied there were any touches and
denied Staff 2 did anything else to try to get closer to her other
than telling her she was beautiful and taking her glasses off her.
Youth A could not recall when these things started happening.
Youth A said Staff 2 got fired because he took a picture of another
youth. Youth A said she does not know why Staff 2 took the
picture or what he took the picture of, but he tried to give it to
another staff and got in trouble for that. Youth A denied that she
had any pictures taken of her and denied he requested any
pictures.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
December 5, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS worker and
Law Enforcement. Youth B said she was placed at Bay Pines
Center with Youth A and when Staff 2 was employed. Youth B
said Youth A had a pattern of “getting in trouble and having
suicidal problems”. Youth B said Youth A had positive
relationships with most of the staff at Bay Pines Center. Youth B
said Staff 2 was employed when she arrived at Bay Pines Center.
Youth B said Staff 2 would talk about youth’s cases in front of
other youth which she did not appreciate. Youth B said Staff 2 was
“fired for taking pictures of a youth in the hospital”. Youth B said
she does not know what were in the pictures he took. Youth B
said she is not aware of Staff 2 taking pictures of youth at any
other times. Youth B said she is not aware of any issues or
concerns between Youth A and Staff 2. Youth B said she is not
aware of any sexual allegations between Youth A and Staff 2.
Youth B said she is not aware of any inappropriate boundaries
with Staff 2 and any youth.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
December 5, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker
and Law Enforcement. Youth C said she was placed at Bay
Pines Center with Youth A and during Staff 2’s employment.
Youth C said Youth A was “restrained a lot” due to hurting staff
both before and during restraints. Youth C said Youth A did not
get along with multiple staff because she did not get her way all
the time. Youth C said Staff 2 was “not a good person” and would
restrain youth without the help of other staff. Youth C said Staff 2
made “sexual comments” one time on the pod stating he was
going to “steal [staff’s] girlfriend and have sex with her”. Youth C
said Staff 2 never made sexual comments to or about the youth
on the unit. Youth C said Staff 2 was “fired for taking pictures of a
youth in the hospital”. Youth C said staff told her about the
pictures and she never saw them. Youth C said she is not aware
3

of any inappropriate boundaries with youth. Youth C said she is
not aware of any inappropriate sexual situations between Staff 2
and Youth A.
Youth D was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
December 5, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker
and Law Enforcement. Youth D said she was placed at Bay
Pines Center with Youth A, and she considered Youth A “her
mother”. Youth D said Youth A was very “dramatic” and “blows
things out of proportion” at times. Youth D said Youth A was very
“caring and nice” and would “listen to her” whenever she had a
difficult day. Youth D said Youth A “liked” Staff 2 and had told her
that Staff 2 talked to her when she was upset. Youth D said Youth
A never told her that Staff 2 was inappropriate with her. Youth D
said Staff 2 was “fired for taking a picture of another youth”
however she did not see the picture and was not aware of what
the picture was. Youth D said she is not aware of Staff 2 taking
pictures of any other youth. Youth D said Staff 2 was never
inappropriate with her and she never saw or heard of him being
inappropriate with any other youth.
Supervisor was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
December 5, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker
and Law Enforcement. Supervisor said he was employed at the
same time at Staff 2 however had limited contact with him as Staff
2 worked a different shift than Supervisor. Supervisor said he
never saw or heard of any concerns about Staff 2 having
inappropriate sexual relationships with any of the youth at Bay
Pines Center. Supervisor said he has no knowledge of any
concern with Staff 2’s interactions with Youth A.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
December 5, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker
and Law Enforcement. Staff 1 said he worked with Staff 2 and
Youth A. Staff 1 had no knowledge of Staff 2 having inappropriate
sexual relationships with Youth A or any other youth. Staff 1 said
Youth A has a history of making things up or exaggerating the
truth when she was not getting her way. Staff 1 said Youth A
never make any accusations about Staff 2 or any other staff being
sexually inappropriate that he is aware of. Staff 1 said he is the
handle with care trainer, and it is common for staff to have to take
a youth’s hand during a restraint to prevent them from hitting or
scratching or may take the hand to control the wrist or arm. Staff 1
said staff would also be trained to remove youth’s glasses during
a restraint if they had a history of self-harm or to prevent them
4

from being broken. Staff 1 confirmed that Youth A would break her
glasses often and had issues with self-harm behavior.
Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone on December 5, 2023, in
collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Staff 2 said he was not
willing to discuss anything that occurred at Bay Pines Center. Staff
2 refused to answer any questions about his interactions with
youth that he worked with at Bay Pines Center. Staff 2 is no longer
employed for the agency.
Staff 3 was interviewed via telephone on December 12, 2023,
in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Staff 3 said she
worked with Staff 2 and Youth A. Staff 3 did not recall a restraint
with Youth A and Staff 2 on April 17, 2022. Staff 3 said she
worked the opposite rotation of Staff 2 however did have a few
shifts that she worked with him. Staff 3 said during the limited time
she did work with Staff 2 she did not see any concerning
interactions between Staff 2 and the youth. Staff 3 denied Youth A
ever disclosing concerns with Staff 2. Staff 3 said Youth A did
have glasses however she broke them frequently and so did not
always wear them. Staff 3 said it was common during restraints
with Youth A to remove her glasses, if she had them on, to
prevent them from breaking or from her being able to get them
and break them. Staff 3 said Youth A would also scratch or “claw”
at staff during restraints and so it was common for staff to have to
hold her hands so that she was not able to harm them during
restraints. Staff 3 said she does not recall any youth making
allegations or having concerns about Staff 2. Staff 3 said if there
were ever concerns about Staff 2, she would have reported it to a
supervisor.
Therapist was interviewed via telephone on December 11,
2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Therapist said
she was Youth A’s therapist throughout the duration of her
placement at Bay Pines Center. Therapist said Youth A never
disclosed anything about Staff 2 to her. Therapist said she is on
the floor throughout her shifts and did see Staff 2 working and
interacting with the youth. Therapist said Staff 2 always presented
as the “model staff” when she was on the unit however Therapist
felt as though Staff 2 may have been acting differently due to her
presence. Therapist said she never had any concerns about his
interactions with the youth. Therapist said another youth that was
friends with Youth A was “obsessed” with Staff 2 and so maybe
that is why Youth A is now making these accusations. Therapist
said she is not aware of Staff 2 restraining Youth A however she
said it may have happened and she just does not recall. Therapist
5

said it is common for staff to have to hold or control a youth’s hand
during a restraint to prevent scratching or hitting. Therapist said it
is common for staff to remove glasses from a youth, especially
Youth A due to her constantly breaking them.
Director was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
December 5, 2023. Director confirmed there was no PREA
investigation completed by the facility for Youth A and Staff 2.
Director said that Staff 2 was placed on suspension for taking a
Snapchat picture while supervising a youth at the hospital.
Director said he never saw the picture and was in the middle of
the investigation into the matter when Staff 2 resigned. Director
said the concern was not that the picture was sexual in nature but
rather a violation of their policy and the youth’s privacy and
confidentiality.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident Report 134940190 dated April 17, 2022, for a
restraint with Youth A completed by Staff 2, witnessed by
Staff 1 and Staff 3. The incident report documented a three-
minute restraint due to Youth A throwing items at peers and
assaulting peers. Staff 2 placed Youth A in a restraint and
escorted her to her room and released and shut the door.
• Staff 2’s personnel file: Staff 2 was placed on administrative
leave on May 6, 2022, and resigned on June 1, 2022.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance with staff qualifications. There is
no evidence that Staff 2 was sexually inappropriate with Youth A
or any other youth at the facility.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
